get.description: Returns the entire swagger spec in json.
Given a specific account public key, this call returns the accounts status, balance and spendable amounts
Get the list of pending transactions by address, sorted by priority, in decreasing order, truncated at the end at MAX. If MAX = 0, returns all pending transactions.
get.summary: Get a list of unconfirmed transactions currently in the transaction pool by address.

400.description: Max must be a non-negative integer

get.summary: Get the block for the given round.

parameters.description: The round from which to fetch block information.
parameters.name: round

get.summary: Get the current supply reported by the ledger.

post.description: Generate (or renew) and register participation keys on the node for a given account address.

parameters.description: The `account-id` to update, or `all` to update all accounts.
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: The fee to use when submitting key registration transactions. Defaults to the suggested fee.
parameters.name: fee

parameters.description: value to use for two-level participation key.
parameters.name: key-dilution

parameters.description: The last round for which the generated participation keys will be valid.
parameters.name: round-last-valid

parameters.description: Don't wait for transaction to commit before returning response.
parameters.name: no-wait

parameters.description: Account address where keys will be registered.
parameters.name: address

post.description: Special management endpoint to shutdown the node. Optionally provide a timeout parameter to indicate that the node should begin shutting down after a number of seconds.

get.description: Waits for a block to appear after round {round} and returns the node's status at the time.
get.summary: Gets the node status after waiting for the given round.

parameters.description: The round to wait until returning status
parameters.name: round

400.description: Bad Request -- number must be non-negative integer

post.summary: Broadcasts a raw transaction to the network.

parameters.description: The byte encoded signed transaction to broadcast to network
parameters.name: rawtxn

get.summary: Get parameters for constructing a new transaction

get.description: Get the list of pending transactions, sorted by priority, in decreasing order, truncated at the end at MAX. If MAX = 0, returns all pending transactions.
get.summary: Get a list of unconfirmed transactions currently in the transaction pool.

get.description:
Given a transaction id of a recently submitted transaction, it returns information about it.  There are several cases when this might succeed:
- transaction committed (committed round > 0) - transaction still in the pool (committed round = 0, pool error = "") - transaction removed from pool due to error (committed round = 0, pool error != "")
Or the transaction may have happened sufficiently long ago that the node no longer remembers it, and this will return an error.
Given a application id, it returns application information including creator, approval and clear programs, global and local schemas, and global state.
Given a asset id, it returns asset information including creator, name, total supply and special addresses.

post.description: Given TEAL source code in plain text, return base64 encoded program bytes and base32 SHA512_256 hash of program bytes (Address style).
post.summary: Compile TEAL source code to binary, produce its hash

parameters.description: TEAL source code to be compiled
parameters.name: source

post.description: Given a catchpoint, it starts catching up to this catchpoint

delete.description: Given a catchpoint, it aborts catching up to this catchpoint

post.description: Executes TEAL program(s) in context and returns debugging information about the execution.
post.summary: Provide debugging information for a transaction (or group).

parameters.description: Transaction (or group) and any accompanying state-simulation data.
parameters.name: request

Account.description:
Account information at a given round.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AccountData

amount.description: \[algo\] total number of MicroAlgos in the account

amount-without-pending-rewards.description: specifies the amount of MicroAlgos in the account, without the pending rewards.

apps-local-state.description:
\[appl\] applications local data stored in this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AppLocalState` for this type.

apps-total-schema.description:
\[tsch\] stores the sum of all of the local schemas and global schemas in this account.

Note: the raw account uses `StateSchema` for this type.

assets.description:
\[asset\] assets held by this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AssetHolding` for this type.

created-apps.description:
\[appp\] parameters of applications created by this account including app global data.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> AppParams` for this type.

created-assets.description:
\[apar\] parameters of assets created by this account.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> Asset` for this type.

pending-rewards.description: amount of MicroAlgos of pending rewards in this account.

reward-base.description: \[ebase\] used as part of the rewards computation. Only applicable to accounts which are participating.

rewards.description: \[ern\] total rewards of MicroAlgos the account has received, including pending rewards.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

status.description:
\[onl\] delegation status of the account's MicroAlgos
* Offline - indicates that the associated account is delegated.
*  Online  - indicates that the associated account used as part of the delegation pool.
*   NotParticipating - indicates that the associated account is neither a delegator nor a delegate.

sig-type.description:
Indicates what type of signature is used by this account, must be one of:
* sig
* msig
* lsig

auth-addr.description: \[spend\] the address against which signing should be checked. If empty, the address of the current account is used. This field can be updated in any transaction by setting the RekeyTo field.

AccountParticipation.description: AccountParticipation describes the parameters used by this account in consensus protocol.

selection-participation-key.description: \[sel\] Selection public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

vote-first-valid.description: \[voteFst\] First round for which this participation is valid.

vote-key-dilution.description: \[voteKD\] Number of subkeys in each batch of participation keys.

vote-last-valid.description: \[voteLst\] Last round for which this participation is valid.

vote-participation-key.description: \[vote\] root participation public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

Asset.description: Specifies both the unique identifier and the parameters for an asset

AssetHolding.description:
Describes an asset held by an account.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AssetHolding

creator.description: Address that created this asset. This is the address where the parameters for this asset can be found, and also the address where unwanted asset units can be sent in the worst case.

is-frozen.description: \[f\] whether or not the holding is frozen.

AssetParams.description:
AssetParams specifies the parameters for an asset.

\[apar\] when part of an AssetConfig transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetParams

clawback.description: \[c\] Address of account used to clawback holdings of this asset.  If empty, clawback is not permitted.

creator.description: The address that created this asset. This is the address where the parameters for this asset can be found, and also the address where unwanted asset units can be sent in the worst case.

decimals.description: \[dc\] The number of digits to use after the decimal point when displaying this asset. If 0, the asset is not divisible. If 1, the base unit of the asset is in tenths. If 2, the base unit of the asset is in hundredths, and so on. This value must be between 0 and 19 (inclusive).

default-frozen.description: \[df\] Whether holdings of this asset are frozen by default.

freeze.description: \[f\] Address of account used to freeze holdings of this asset.  If empty, freezing is not permitted.

manager.description: \[m\] Address of account used to manage the keys of this asset and to destroy it.

metadata-hash.description: \[am\] A commitment to some unspecified asset metadata. The format of this metadata is up to the application.

name.description: \[an\] Name of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

reserve.description: \[r\] Address of account holding reserve (non-minted) units of this asset.

total.description: \[t\] The total number of units of this asset.

unit-name.description: \[un\] Name of a unit of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

url.description: \[au\] URL where more information about the asset can be retrieved.

ApplicationStateSchema.description: Specifies maximums on the number of each type that may be stored.

ApplicationLocalState.description: Stores local state associated with an application.

id.description: The application which this local state is for.

TealKeyValueStore.description: Represents a key-value store for use in an application.

TealKeyValue.description: Represents a key-value pair in an application store.

ApplicationParams.description: Stores the global information associated with an application.

creator.description: The address that created this application. This is the address where the parameters and global state for this application can be found.

DryrunState.description: Stores the TEAL eval step data

DryrunTxnResult.description: DryrunTxnResult contains any LogicSig or ApplicationCall program debug information and state updates from a dryrun.

ErrorResponse.description: An error response with optional data field.

Version.description:
Note that we annotate this as a model so that legacy clients
can directly import a swagger generated Version model.

VersionBuild.description: the current algod build version information.

DryrunRequest.description: Request data type for dryrun endpoint. Given the Transactions and simulated ledger state upload, run TEAL scripts and return debugging information.

items.description: SignedTxn object. Must be canonically encoded.

protocol-version.description: ProtocolVersion specifies a specific version string to operate under, otherwise whatever the current protocol of the network this algod is running in.

round.description: Round is available to some TEAL scripts. Defaults to the current round on the network this algod is attached to.

latest-timestamp.description: LatestTimestamp is available to some TEAL scripts. Defaults to the latest confirmed timestamp this algod is attached to.

DryrunSource.description: DryrunSource is TEAL source text that gets uploaded, compiled, and inserted into transactions or application state.

field-name.description: FieldName is what kind of sources this is. If lsig then it goes into the transactions[this.TxnIndex].LogicSig. If approv or clearp it goes into the Approval Program or Clear State Program of application[this.AppIndex].

address.description: Only include transactions with this address in one of the transaction fields.
address.name: address

address-role.description: Combine with the address parameter to define what type of address to search for.
address-role.name: address-role

after-time.description: Include results after the given time. Must be an RFC 3339 formatted string.
after-time.name: after-time

before-time.description: Include results before the given time. Must be an RFC 3339 formatted string.
before-time.name: before-time

currency-greater-than.description: Results should have an amount greater than this value. MicroAlgos are the default currency unless an asset-id is provided, in which case the asset will be used.
currency-greater-than.name: currency-greater-than

currency-less-than.description: Results should have an amount less than this value. MicroAlgos are the default currency unless an asset-id is provided, in which case the asset will be used.
currency-less-than.name: currency-less-than

exclude-close-to.description: Combine with address and address-role parameters to define what type of address to search for. The close to fields are normally treated as a receiver, if you would like to exclude them set this parameter to true.
exclude-close-to.name: exclude-close-to

format.description: Configures whether the response object is JSON or MessagePack encoded.
format.name: format

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return.
limit.name: limit

max.description: Truncated number of transactions to display. If max=0, returns all pending txns.
max.name: max

max-round.description: Include results at or before the specified max-round.
max-round.name: max-round

min-round.description: Include results at or after the specified min-round.
min-round.name: min-round

next.description: The next page of results. Use the next token provided by the previous results.
next.name: next

note-prefix.description: Specifies a prefix which must be contained in the note field.
note-prefix.name: note-prefix

round.description: Include results for the specified round.
round.name: round

sig-type.description:
SigType filters just results using the specified type of signature:
* sig - Standard
* msig - MultiSig
* lsig - LogicSig
sig-type.name: sig-type

tx-id.description: Lookup the specific transaction by ID.
tx-id.name: tx-id

cert.description: Optional certificate object. This is only included when the format is set to message pack.

schema.description: NodeStatus contains the information about a node status

last-round.description: LastRound indicates the last round seen

last-version.description: LastVersion indicates the last consensus version supported

next-version.description: NextVersion of consensus protocol to use

next-version-round.description: NextVersionRound is the round at which the next consensus version will apply

next-version-supported.description: NextVersionSupported indicates whether the next consensus version is supported by this node

stopped-at-unsupported-round.description: StoppedAtUnsupportedRound indicates that the node does not support the new rounds and has stopped making progress

last-catchpoint.description: The last catchpoint seen by the node

catchpoint.description: The current catchpoint that is being caught up to

catchpoint-total-accounts.description: The total number of accounts included in the current catchpoint

catchpoint-processed-accounts.description: The number of account from the current catchpoint that have been processed so far as part of the catchup

catchpoint-total-blocks.description: The total number of blocks that are required to complete the current catchpoint catchup

catchpoint-acquired-blocks.description: The number of blocks that have already been obtained by the node as part of the catchup

PendingTransactionResponse.description:
Given a transaction id of a recently submitted transaction, it returns information about it.  There are several cases when this might succeed:
- transaction committed (committed round > 0)
- transaction still in the pool (committed round = 0, pool error = "")
- transaction removed from pool due to error (committed round = 0, pool error != "")

Or the transaction may have happened sufficiently long ago that the node no longer remembers it, and this will return an error.

schema.description: Details about a pending transaction. If the transaction was recently confirmed, includes confirmation details like the round and reward details.

asset-index.description: The asset index if the transaction was found and it created an asset.

application-index.description: The application index if the transaction was found and it created an application.

close-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the close remainder to account.

confirmed-round.description: The round where this transaction was confirmed, if present.

pool-error.description: Indicates that the transaction was kicked out of this node's transaction pool (and specifies why that happened).  An empty string indicates the transaction wasn't kicked out of this node's txpool due to an error.

receiver-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the receiver account.

sender-rewards.description: Rewards in microalgos applied to the sender account.

local-state-delta.description: \[ld\] Local state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

global-state-delta.description: \[gd\] Global state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

PendingTransactionsResponse.description: A potentially truncated list of transactions currently in the node's transaction pool. You can compute whether or not the list is truncated if the number of elements in the **top-transactions** array is fewer than **total-transactions**.

schema.description: PendingTransactions is an array of signed transactions exactly as they were submitted.

top-transactions.description: An array of signed transaction objects.

total-transactions.description: Total number of transactions in the pool.

SupplyResponse.description: Supply represents the current supply of MicroAlgos in the system.

schema.description: Supply represents the current supply of MicroAlgos in the system

TransactionParametersResponse.description: TransactionParams contains the parameters that help a client construct a new transaction.

schema.description:
TransactionParams contains the parameters that help a client construct
a new transaction.

consensus-version.description:
ConsensusVersion indicates the consensus protocol version
as of LastRound.

fee.description:
Fee is the suggested transaction fee
Fee is in units of micro-Algos per byte.
Fee may fall to zero but transactions must still have a fee of
at least MinTxnFee for the current network protocol.

genesis-hash.description: GenesisHash is the hash of the genesis block.

genesis-id.description: GenesisID is an ID listed in the genesis block.

last-round.description: LastRound indicates the last round seen

min-fee.description:
The minimum transaction fee (not per byte) required for the
txn to validate for the current network protocol.

hash.description: base32 SHA512_256 of program bytes (Address style)

DryrunResponse.description: DryrunResponse contains per-txn debug information from a dryrun.

protocol-version.description: Protocol version is the protocol version Dryrun was operated under.

api_key.description: Generated header parameter. This token can be generated using the Goal command line tool. Example value ='b7e384d0317b8050ce45900a94a1931e28540e1f69b2d242b424659c341b4697'
api_key.name: X-Algo-API-Token
